org.terrier.structures.indexing.singlepass.hadoop

Class NewSplitEmittedTerm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.terrier.structures.indexing.singlepass.hadoop.NewSplitEmittedTerm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<NewSplitEmittedTerm>, org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable, org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable<NewSplitEmittedTerm>

    public class NewSplitEmittedTerm
extends Object
implements org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable<NewSplitEmittedTerm>
    Represents a Term key used during MapReduce Indexing. Term keys are emitted from each map task, and are used for sorting and partitioning the output. Paritioning is done by splitno. Two options for sorting (a) term only, (b) term, split, flush
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    richardm

      • NewSplitEmittedTerm

        public NewSplitEmittedTerm()
        Empty Constructor

      • NewSplitEmittedTerm

        public NewSplitEmittedTerm(String term,
                   int splitno,
                   int flushno)
        Constructor for a Term key. Is used for sorting map output and partitioning posting lists between reducers. Each term is only unique in conjunction with the split and flush that it was emitted from.
        Parameters:
        term -
        splitno -
        flushno -
